item.title: How Brexit, a Startling Act of Economic Self-Harm, Foreshadowed Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Britain’s decision to leave the European Union in 2016 was sold to voters as a magic bullet that would revitalize the country’s economy. Its impact is...

item.title: Manchester Arena Bomber’s Brother Is Accused of Attack on Prison Guards
item.description: Hashem Abedi allegedly stabbed the officers with homemade weapons inside a high-security prison.

item.title: For Taiwan’s Small Exporters, the Uncertainty’s as Bad as the Tariffs
item.description: The island’s many small factories have thrived by being frugal — and flexible. But President Trump’s unpredictability is testing their limits.

item.title: Hostages Still Held in Gaza Cast Shadow Over Passover in Israel
item.description: The holiday is usually a celebration of the liberation of ancient Israelites from slavery in Egypt. But for many Israelis, the suffering of the captiv...

item.title: Sudan Clinic Workers Killed in Zamzam Camp
item.description: Relief International said nine employees were killed when gunmen stormed the Zamzam camp in El Fasher, in the western Darfur region.
